FuncDef:
The pki set-certificate expire-prewarning command sets the expiration warning date for the local certificate and the CA certificate in the memory.
The undo pki set-certificate expire-prewarning command restores the expiration warning date for the local certificate and the CA certificate in the memory to the default value. The pki set-certificate expire-prewarning command sets the expiration warning date for the local certificate and the CA certificate in the memory. The undo pki set-certificate expire-prewarning command restores the expiration warning date for the local certificate and the CA certificate in the memory to the default value. By default, the expiration warning date for the local certificate and the CA certificate in the memory is ninety days.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the expiration warning date.
The value is an integer that ranges from 7 to 180. By default, the value is 90.
